TopicTitle: Looks like we have an announcement!

Articles.Content:
As tweeted by KSP themselves

https://twitter.com/KerbalSpaceP/status/410882742449373186

Yay!

Edited December 11, 2013 by WillHop

Yay office firewall which blocks social networking sites

Whats the news?
KSP 0.23 confirmed release Tuesday 17th, as tweeted by KSP themselves
Thanks, this news makes me happy! Jeb just ran off though... Screaming Oh god no please no more!
Nice to have a date. Guess we have to wait till tomorrow to hear the exact contents.
Well then.... .23 in T minus 6 days!!!

I though that squad never told release dates...

anyway, I hope it's true!

And now the most horrifying doubt: what if someone hacked the account and made a false release date?

Also, I wonder why they just announced it on twitter. It's not that I'm jealous of the twitter users but a release date is important enough to be announced everywhere(right?)
/engage timewarp x100000

I though that squad never told release dates...

anyway, I hope it's true!

And now the most horrifying doubt: what if someone hacked the account and made a false release date?

Also, I wonder why they just announced it on twitter. It's not that I'm jealous of the twitter users but a release date is important enough to be announced everywhere(right?)

Good question - PC Gamer did post an article claiming it would be the 17th which they mentioned in a previous tweet but that was the first place I saw it.
Hold on... Squad gave us a date?!?!?!

Hold on... Squad gave us a date?!?!?!

Yep, they have broken their traditions for the last 2 updates

Yep, they have broken their traditions for the last 2 updates

I'm not complaining about breaking a tradition the least bit this time!

I'm not complaining about breaking a tradition the least bit this time!

Me neither
Where's the announcement from SQUAD about this on this site? Mighty nice of them to keep all the hype on that terrible Twitter platform.

Where's the announcement from SQUAD about this on this site? Mighty nice of them to keep all the hype on that terrible Twitter platform.

Not a clue, took me off guard to be honest

Not a clue, took me off guard to be honest

Well, thanks for doing what they're not.

Looks like I'm starting again

(Need to finish a Duna mission! Must hurry!)

Maybe they posted it there because they're really busy with KerbalKon and knew that within 10 seconds someone would post it here?

You know the information now. What's the big deal where they said it or who saw it first?
Guess its time to build that time machine to go 6 days into the future. Oh wait I have one, its called my bed, with ear plug equipment.

You know the information now. What's the big deal where they said it or who saw it first?

This forum has a section titled "Announcements"; it probably would have taken their "Social Media Manager" ten seconds longer to post a new thread there as well as to Twitter.

My real beef with that is that I don't follow Twitter, or Reddit, or whatever else they're posting on, I follow these forums which are hosted by SQUAD. If SQUAD can't be bothered to post information here then what is the point of having this forum in the first place? Having a centralized place where users can come to discuss and be updated on the product would be really nice, but instead I have to rely on other users to bring that information here. These other users are doing a better job than people who are hired to do those things.
Darn, now I have to wait to start my new Space Programme. I've had numerous ones be cut drastically short due to updates!
Is this update going to erase our current career files?

Is this update going to erase our current career files?

Harvester said on another thread that this update should not break saves.
Cool, this gives me more than enough time to get all my guys home and get ready to start career mode all over again.

Darn, now I have to wait to start my new Space Programme. I've had numerous ones be cut drastically short due to updates!

This is the dilemma I've been having! To start again or not to start again, that is the question - although a lot of the mods I use will probably not be compatible so that will probably mean starting again vanilla anyway
